data: A Lady, entering the florist’s with her muff to her face, and fluttering gayly up to the counter, where the florist stands folding a mass of loose flowers in a roll of cotton batting: "Good-morning, Mr. Eichenlaub! Ah, put plenty of cotton round the poor things, if you don’t want them frozen stiff!
browsing: literature|browsing: fiction|category: plays/films/dramas|category: american literature
